summary: An FBI email from July 2011 discussing an inmate (IMMI) who provided a taped interview to Newsweek and possibly the Daily Mail regarding his knowledge of the 1985 homicide of attorney Arthur Shapiro and Jeffrey Epstein's alleged connection to the case. The email notes prior difficulties in interviewing the inmate and coordination between FBI offices.

persons.name: Arthur Shapiro
persons.context: Mentioned as the victim of a 1985 homicide that Jeffrey Epstein is allegedly connected to according to an inmate's statements.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in connection to the 1985 homicide of Arthur Shapiro based on information from an inmate.

connections.description: Epstein is alleged by an inmate to have a connection to Shapiro's 1985 homicide case.

events.title: Homicide of Arthur Shapiro
events.description: Arthur Shapiro, an attorney, was killed in a homicide in 1985.

events.title: Failed FBI interview attempt
events.description: Agents attempted to interview an inmate regarding Shapiro's homicide and Epstein's connection, but the inmate refused to speak without a court-appointed attorney.

events.title: Inmate provides taped interview to media
events.description: An inmate (IMMI) provided a 1-hour taped interview to Newsweek and possibly the Daily Mail regarding his knowledge of Shapiro's homicide and Epstein's alleged connection.

locations: Trenton RA (likely FBI Resident Agency in Trenton, NJ)
Ft. Dix (military base/correctional facility in New Jersey)
FBI Miami Division, 505 Flagler Dr. Ste. 500, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
Columbus (likely Columbus, Ohio, related to Shapiro's homicide)
keyFacts: An inmate (IMMI) claimed to have information linking Jeffrey Epstein to the 1985 homicide of attorney Arthur Shapiro.
The inmate refused to speak to FBI agents in October 2010 without a court-appointed attorney.
On or before July 6, 2011, the inmate provided a 1-hour taped interview to Newsweek and possibly the Daily Mail about the case.
The FBI was actively investigating leads related to Epstein's potential connection to a decades-old homicide case as of 2011.
Coordination occurred between FBI offices in Trenton, Ft. Dix, and Miami regarding this lead.
